fields.title: About us..
fields.content:
Mission

Enabling the transformation of the energy efficiency market through innovative software solutions that deliver efficiency, accuracy and transparency.

At Pivotal Energy Solutions we are a committed team of hard working professionals who enjoy creating and delivering software and tools that radically improve the way in which energy efficiency data is collected, displayed, and shared.


Learn more »

fields.title: Pivotal Energy Solutions
fields.content:
Pivotal Energy Solutions is a technology company focused on delivering innovative software solutions for the energy efficiency market. Our flagship product, Axis, is a cloud-hosted software platform designed to enable operational efficiencies and transparency for energy efficiency program administrators, participants, and evaluators.


Used by leading program sponsors and utilities such as NEEA, Energy Trust of Oregon, and Arizona Public Service, Axis serves as a centralized data collection, storage, and sharing hub with integrated workflow management and messaging functionality. In addition to supporting the RESNET energy rating protocols, the modular architecture of Axis allows for customization of functionality, visibility, and workflows to meet program-specific needs.

Confidential Information does not include any information that is publically available through or from third parties.

Such injunctive relief or other measures will be in addition to, and not in lieu of, any other rights and remedies available to the disclosing or owning Party.
  1. Term and Termination. The terms of this Agreement shall continue unless terminated as provided in this Section. This Agreement will terminate automatically, without notice or liability to Licensee or any third party, in the event of a material breach by Licensee of any of the agreed upon terms and conditions stated herein.   2. Survival. The provisions of Sections 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, and this Section 5 shall survive any termination of this Agreement. Further, Recipient’s confidentiality obligations under Section 3 shall not be affected by bankruptcy, assignment, attachment, or seizure procedures, whether initiated by or against Licensee, nor by the rejection of any agreement between Licensor and Licensee, by a trustee of Licensee in bankruptcy, or by the Licensee as a debtor in possession or the equivalent of any of the foregoing under local law.

Licensor may collect and summarize the data in the aggregate for analytics (“Collected Data”) using the Software, the Website, or other means, and store the Collected Data in the Database or a different database. Any data or information collected and/or compiled by Licensor under this Agreement shall be performed in such a manner that (a) no Personally Identifiable Information may be derived therefrom, and (b) the results of any Collected Data shall not include any Personally Identifiable Information. Any litigation arising out of or under this Agreement or Licensee’s use of the Products may be brought only in federal or state courts located in Maricopa County in the State of Arizona. The parties waive any and all objections to the venue in those Courts and hereby submit to the jurisdiction of those courts. All remaining provisions will remain in full force and effect, and this Agreement will be interpreted as if it had not contained the severed provision.
    12. Waiver Of Class Action Rights. By entering into this Agreement, Licensee hereby irrevocably waives any right Licensee may have to join claims with those of others in the form of a class action or similar procedural device. Any claims arising out of, relating to, or in connection with this Agreement must be asserted individually.
    13. Headings. Captions and section headings used herein are for reference purposes only and will not control or alter the meaning of this Agreement as set forth in the text.
    14. Entire Agreement. Except as otherwise provided for herein, this Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties pertaining to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, negotiations and understandings, oral or written, between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and it supersedes all prior and contemporaneous, oral and written agreements and understandings with respect to the same. This Agreement may be modified only by an instrument in writing executed by duly authorized representatives of each Party. In the event of any conflict between a provision of this Agreement and a provision of any Exhibit, the provision of this Agreement will control.

fields.title: Products
fields.content:
Axis is a cloud-based data and workflow management platform that streamlines energy ratings and energy efficiency program participation through data sharing by connecting raters/verifiers, HERS providers, home builders, HVAC contractors, QA organizations, utilities, program evaluators, and others using a centralized data repository. Contact us to learn more about Axis.

HERS Raters and Certification Organizations

  • Track your homes in shared system.
  • Import Architectural Energy Corporation’s REM/Rate™ data and populate inspection checklists.
  • Export and upload or populate ENERGY STAR 3.0 checklists on a per-home basis or as a batch process.

Utilities and Program Sponsors

  • Create custom Energy Efficiency Programs (EEPs) and define program data collection requirements and incentive levels
  • Review home inspection and energy model data
  • Process incentive payments
  • Store program documentation
  • Customized report generation

Builders

  • Immediate access to Rater inspection reports for Builder homes
  • Track incentive payments
  • Review Energy Savings prior to construction
  • Customized report generation


With Axis, we will have access to more comprehensive data to QA homes within our program.

Tom Hines of Arizona Public Service

fields.title: APS Selects Pivotal’s Axis for ENERGY STAR® New Homes Program Data Management
fields.content:
Arizona Public Service (APS), Arizona’s largest electric utility company serving over one million customers in 11 of the state’s 15 counties, has selected Pivotal Energy Solutions’ Axis software platform to manage the data for its award winning APS ENERGY STAR® Homes new construction program starting in 2012.


APS administers their New Homes program internally and Tom Hines, Program Manager at APS, believes “Axis will reduce our administrative costs by enabling data sharing and automated report generation and notifications for our Rater/Provider and Builder partners.” Axis’s cloud-hosted database architecture allows for authenticated users working together on an APS ENERGY STAR® home to populate and share checklists, share inspection schedules and results, and monitor qualification status. As the program sponsor, APS will use the data collected to review and approve incentive payments. “Axis will allow us to collect not only energy simulation files and data but the complete ENERGY STAR® version 3 Thermal Enclosure checklists from Rater/Certification Organizations for homes in our program. With Axis, we will have access to more comprehensive data to QA homes within our program,” says Tom. Axis supports incentive payment processing for program sponsors and invoice generation and tracking for Rater/Certification Organizations and HVAC contractors. Axis also supports the RESNET sampling protocol to assist Certification Organizations with tracking sampling controls and creating sampling batches. “We’ve enjoyed working with the Pivotal team and look forward to our deployment of Axis in the coming months,” Tom added.

fields.title: Pivotal in Orlando in 2013 (twice!)
fields.content: Pivotal Energy Solutions will be hosting a booth at AESP’s 23rd National Conference, January 29 through 31, 2013, in Orlando, Florida. A month later, we’ll also be back in Orlando hosting an expo booth for the 2013 RESNET Conference , February 27 through March 1. Come visit us for a demo of Axis or contact us directly for a private demonstration during the conference.

fields.title: NEEA Selects Pivotal’s Axis for Northwest ENERGY STAR® Homes Program Data Management
fields.content:
The Northwest Energy Efficiency Alliance (NEEA) has selected the Axis software platform from Pivotal Energy Solutions to manage the data for its award winning Northwest ENERGY STAR® Homes new construction program starting in 2013. The Northwest ENERGY STAR® Homes program is a regional initiative intended to promote the construction of energy efficient homes using the guidelines set forth by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). The program is available to participants in Oregon, Washington, Idaho, and Montana, and enabled the certification of over 3,000 ENERGY STAR® homes in 2012.


The Northwest ENERGY STAR® Homes program is made possible by the Northwest Energy Efficiency Alliance (NEEA), a private nonprofit organization funded by more than 100 Northwest utilities, the Energy Trust of Oregon and the Bonneville Power Administration. NEEA has won the U.S. EPA’s ENERGY STAR® Award For Excellence, Partner Of The Year for Program Delivery, and Sustained Excellence awards as it continues it’s mission to mobilize the Northwest to become increasingly energy efficient for a sustainable future.

fields.title: Updated Selects - On the road to the New UI
fields.content: You may have noticed that we are making small changes as we prepare for our revamped User Interface (UI) deployment coming over the next several months. The latest changes involve a small change to some of our HTML Selectors in forms. (Read More....)

fields.title: No Geocoding Matches - What gives!
fields.content: Central to Axis is the ability to geocode a location. The geocoding process involves taking an address (or an intersection) you entered and feeding that to a number of GIS (Geographic Information Services)... Read More...

fields.title: New Release 2.0.13
fields.content: A new release of the Axis user interface has been released with some important changes which may affect you... Read More...

fields.title: Government Shutdown - EPA Updates
fields.content: With the government shutdown in effect, the The EPA website and partner feeds including Builder and Rater status updates will not be getting updated.  This will resume once the the federal government reopens. We apologize for the inconvenience.

fields.title: New Release 2.1.1 - Streamlining home creation
fields.content: This weekend we are rolling out a new feature to improve the workflow for raters and providers. We are excited about this release because it originated from you. You wanted a faster way to create a home. We have taken this feedback and have implemented a number of new enhancements to make the process of getting data into axis easier. Read More...

fields.title: New Release 2.6.1 - REM/Rate® 14.4 / Caching
fields.content: A new release of the Axis has been released with some important changes which may affect you... Read More...

fields.title: Energy Trust of Oregon Selects Pivotal’s Axis for their EPS™ New Homes Program
fields.content:
Energy Trust of Oregon, a leader in energy efficiency program design and delivery, has selected the Axis software platform from Pivotal Energy Solutions to administer their EPS energy efficiency program targeted for residential new construction. EPS is an energy performance score that helps homebuyers in Oregon assess a newly built home’s energy consumption, utility costs, and carbon footprint by rating the efficiency of that home and comparing it against similarly sized homes in Oregon. More than 4,000 Oregon homes have received an EPS since 2009.


Energy Trust of Oregon is an independent nonprofit organization dedicated to helping utility customers benefit from saving energy and tapping renewable resources. Their services, cash incentives and energy solutions have helped participating customers of Portland General Electric, Pacific Power, NW Natural and Cascade Natural Gas save on energy bills. Energy Trust’s work helps keep energy costs as low as possible, creates jobs and builds a sustainable energy future.

fields.title: Release 2.7.2 - Updates to Associations
fields.content: Associations are a key component to Axis and allow you to share information with other companies. They are created by adding a company to an object like a home or subdivision. This latest release updates associations (aka relationships). Last nights change took away some of the ‘mystery’ in associations but gave you a lot more flexibility which we feel you will appreciate. Read More..

fields.title: Release 2.7.5 - Multiple Program Support
fields.content: The ability to add multiple programs onto homes has been supported since the beginning of Axis. However it was recently requested that we support adding programs onto homes once the initial program has been certified. Read More..

fields.title: Release 3.0
fields.content: This weekend we released a new revision of Axis. We are very excited about this release and it has some important changes which may affect you. Click through to read more about the upcoming changes Read More..

fields.title: Release 3.1
fields.content: Tonight we released a new revision of Axis. We are very excited about this release and it has some important changes which may affect you. Click through to read more about the upcoming changes Read More..

fields.title: REM/Rate® 14.5 - Released
fields.content: Last week Architectural Energy Corporation (AEC) released version 14.5 which corrects a number of issues including the issue our customers identified with Air Source Heat Pumps. You can download the latest version here. For a full list of the changes in 14.5 is also available.

fields.title: Happy Independance Day - Release 3.2
fields.content: Earlier this week we released a new revision of Axis. We are very excited about this release and it has some important changes which may affect you including Utility Validations on NWESH programs, Minimum Incentive Payments for Certification Organizations on ETO Programs, and improvements to Incentive Payment Processing. Click through to read more about the upcoming changes Read More..

fields.title: Looking for the old UI?
fields.content: If you are looking for the old UI you can find legacy Axis at https://axis.v2.pivotalenergy.netand legacy NEEA at https://neea.v2.pivotalenergy.net. The old UI is no longer maintained and will eventually no longer function. If there is something we overlooked please send let us know by filing a ticket with Support. Thanks!

fields.title: New Release 3.3 - Multi-Family Support / REM/Rate® Updates
fields.content: Tonight we released a new revision of Axis. We are very excited about this release and it has some important changes which may affect you including Multi-Family support on Homes, Improved messaging on bulk uploads and an improved REM/Rate® export backend process. Click through to read more about the upcoming changes Read More..

fields.title: The North Carolina Building Performance Association Selects Pivotal’s Axis for their state-wide HERS Providership
fields.content:
The North Carolina Building Performance Association (NCBPA), a non-profit trade association dedicated to growing North Carolina’s building performance industry, has selected the Axis software platform from Pivotal Energy Solutions to administer various residential new construction energy efficiency programs available in North Carolina and surrounding states. A variety of programs will be offered through Axis for the NCBPA Rater community as will all RESNET required QA/QC.


The North Carolina Building Performance Association, based in Raleigh, N.C., provides residents and businesses with the resources they need to live and work in healthy, safe, durable, cost-effective and environmentally friendly homes and buildings. The association advocates for growth in building and energy codes, promotes the industry workforce and provides services to member companies that help sustain North Carolina’s reputation as a national leader in building performance. For more information about NCBPA, click here.

fields.title: New Release 3.4 - Sampling
fields.content: Tonight we released a new revision of Axis. We are very excited about this release and it has some important changes which may affect you including a completely new Sampling User Interface (UI) which we call Sampling Control Center. In this release you can now much more effectively manage samplesets from simple modifications to full sampling management. We are still putting the finishing touches on training and documentation so stay tuned or ask one of your friendly support representatives for more information.

fields.title: Release 3.5
fields.content: We are excited to announce the release of version 3.5 of Axis on March 31, 2015. Axis users will see some changes to the interaction with communities, subdivisions, and homes. Our goal with Axis Version 3.5 (v3.5) is to improve a user’s ability to create and edit homes, subdivisions, and communities. It also provides minor layout changes to better use page space, enhances document handling, updates widgets and caching methodologies, adds file type validation, and includes other performance improvements. Read more..

fields.title: Release 3.6 - Notifications
fields.content: Tonight we are pleased to announce a new release 3.6. Pivotal has completely overhauled how we handle notifications in the platform. This update now presents new notifications as real-time popups on the recipient's screen, which can easily be dismissed, marked as "read", or linked to an actionable page. A new notification indicator in the top menu bar shows, at-a-glance, the number of unread notifications and provides the ability to view notifications. Lastly, the message center gives the ability to determine how you want notifications delivered (Email, anyone?). More information is available here.

fields.title: Axis Release 3.9 - Home Notes
fields.content: We are pleased to release new functionality to Axis that allows users to add shareable notes directly to a home! Home notes provide a simple way for a user to record a note that is only shared among that user's company in Axis, and also to share notes with users for ALL companies associated with the home in Axis. You can find more information here

fields.title: Axis User Group Meeting to be held in Portland Oct. 13
fields.content:
Pivotal will be holding it's first Axis User Group Meeting in Portland, Oct. 12, 2015. Pivotal clients and users will be gathering to "compare and contrast" how they use Axis to support their respective energy efficiency programs and collaboratively plan the Axis development roadmap for 2016.


If you'd like to attend, please contact us to receive additional information regarding the time and place of the meeting by clicking here or calling us at (480) 256-2737.

fields.title: Find us at the EPA ENERGY STAR Stakeholders Meeting in Portland Oct. 13-15!
fields.content: The Pivotal team will be attending this year's EPA ENERGY STAR Stakeholders Meeting to be held in Portland, OR, Oct. 13 through 15. Please let us know if you'll be attending as well and if you'd like to set up a time for a quick demo of Axis, our energy efficiency data hub. Find out more about the ENERGY STAR meeting by clicking here.

fields.title: Axis Release 3.10
fields.content: We are happy to announce a new release that includes multiple improvements and bug fixes along with enhanced Provider functionality. You may notice changes in appearance to data tables as well as the Axis login function. Export of data tables to multiple file types now works better and more reliably. The enhanced Provider functionality now supports different types of QA, bulk certification of homes, and a streamlined dashboard. If you have any questions, please contact us using our support page.

fields.title: Join us at RESNET 2016!
fields.content: Pivotal will be hosting a booth on the exhibit floor and offering a pre-conference session at the 2016 RESNET conference to be held in Scottsdale, Arizona, February 29 through March 2 to demonstrate our Axis software platform and share with you our plans for 2016!  The pre-conference session has been scheduled for SATURDAY, February 27, so please take that into consideration when booking your travel.  Registration for the pre-conference session is available through RESNET, or contact us using the "Contact" button above and we'll get you registered.  We look forward to seeing you in Scottsdale!!

fields.title: Pivotal Licenses Appraisal Institute's Green Addendum
fields.content:
Pivotal Energy Solutions is pleased to announce the licensing of the Appraisal Institute's Residential Green and Energy Efficient Addendum (G&EEA) enabling auto-population of the G&EEA directly from its Axis platform. The Appraisal Institute, the world's largest professional organization of real estate appraisers, developed the G&EEA for use by appraisers to document the energy efficiency features of a home for appraisal purposes. Through an agreement with the Appraisal Institute, Pivotal's Axis platform generates and auto-populates the Green Addendum using home energy rating and energy efficiency program data.

Pivotal's Axis platform is a cloud-based data collection, storage, and sharing solution used by HERS Raters and Certification Organizations, home builders, and energy efficiency program sponsors to streamline data collection for energy ratings and energy efficiency programs such as ENERGY STAR Homes. By offering an auto-populated Green Addendum within Axis, Pivotal seeks to eliminate data entry errors while documenting the energy efficiency features of new homes in a consistent manner to enable the proper valuation of high-performance homes within the real estate market.

For more information about the Appraisal Institute and the Residential Green and Energy Efficient Addendum, go to http://www.appraisalinstitute.org/education/education-resources/green-building-resources/. For more information about Pivotal's Axis platform, contact Bob Burns at 800-980-AXIS.

fields.title: UPDATE - File QA
fields.content: Pivotal has released new functionality for Axis that lays the foundation for better QA support and improved use of the Axis landing page (the page you land on after logging in and after clicking the Axis logo in the upper left corner of any page) to surface program and QA metrics prominently. Depending upon the program you participate in, this functionality may or may not currently be available to you. This update also adds automated file QA capabilities to Axis. You can read more about this and watch a brief demo video on our support site.

fields.title: Bonded Builders Warranty Group and Pivotal Energy Solutions form new Partnership
fields.content:
Bonded Builders Warranty Group (BBWG) and Pivotal Energy Solutions are pleased to announce the availability of BBWG’s Residential Energy Guarantee (REG) program through Pivotal’s Axis Platform.

The REG is an exclusive program available to builders who construct and certify homes that meet industry standards for energy efficiency such as HERS, Energy Star, LEED or National Green Building Standard. This first-of-its-kind program for new homes is the only national program which guarantees energy usage of the entire home based on standards set by the Residential Energy Service Network (RESNET). The program reimburses the homeowner for cost of gas and electricity usage exceeding the home’s predicted energy usage by more than 15%.

Axis is a cloud-based data collection, storage, and sharing solution used by HERS Raters, new home builders, and program sponsors to streamline the data collection process for energy ratings and energy efficiency programs such as ENERGY STAR Homes.

By offering the BBWG REG through Axis, BBWG is making it even easier for builders and home owners to enroll in the REG program and guarantee their new home's energy performance. For more information about BBWG's REG, contact Steve Hooker at 800-749-0381 x4618. For more information about Pivotal's Axis platform, contact Bob Burns at 800-980-AXIS.

Learn more about Bonded Builders Warranty Group, please visit www.bondedbuilders.com.

fields.title: RELEASE - Inspection Checklist
fields.content: Pivotal has released an update to Axis that enhances our inspection checklist functionality. If you have ever used the Axis user interface to provide checklist answers, then this applies to you. The enhancements will change the look of the checklist, but also allow us to give you more options for navigating the checklist and quickly answering the checklist questions. The underlying changes were made with an eye toward mobile and also support enhanced field QA functionality that we have developed. Learn more...

fields.title: Pivotal and Ekotrope Announce Collaboration to Streamline Energy Ratings
fields.content:
Pivotal Energy Solutions and Ekotrope announced today a collaboration enabling the generation of energy ratings and energy consumption data directly from Pivotal's Axis platform. Axis will be the first product to utilize Ekotrope's new general purpose application programming interface (API) to enable cloud-based simulations using the RESNET accredited Ekotrope engine.

Pivotal's Axis platform is a cloud-based data collection, storage, and sharing solution used by HERS Raters and Certification Organizations, home builders, and energy efficiency program sponsors to streamline data collection for energy ratings and energy efficiency programs such as ENERGY STAR Homes. By offering the Ekotrope engine from within Axis, Pivotal can offer HERS Raters the ability to enter preliminary rating data, generate a preliminary rating, validate and correct preliminary rating data from the field, generate a confirmed rating, and submit rating data to their Provider all from within a single, cloud-based platform. The Axis/Ekotrope collaboration also provides energy efficiency programs an hourly-simulation option for the calculation of energy consumption and savings.

By offering access to their cloud-based energy simulation engine, Ekotrope seeks to expand its market beyond new home builders into energy ratings to support HERS energy performance ratings and utility programs at a time when hourly simulation is becoming a requirement in the market.

For more information about Pivotal's Axis platform, go to www.PivotalEnergySolutions.com, or contact Bob Burns at 800-980-AXIS. For more information about Ekotrope, go to www.ekotrope.com.

fields.title: Release – Create Home from REM/Rate file
fields.content: We are pleased to announce new functionality that Pivotal has released for the Axis platform to enable the creation of a home record in Axis by simply uploading a REM/Rate file (.blg). Users may now upload the REM/Rate file and Axis will populate home information such as address, companies, rater and floorplan info. This functionality can eliminate the need to enter manually into Axis the data that you have already entered into REM/Rate, increasing the efficiency of program participation. More details can be found on our support site….

fields.title: NGBS™ and Pivotal Energy Solutions Announce Data Sharing Agreement
fields.content:
Home Innovation Research Labs and Pivotal Energy Solutions are pleased to announce the availability of NGBS Green Certified homes through Pivotal’s Axis energy efficiency data collection and sharing platform.

Over 85,000 U.S. homes have met the requirements of the ICC 700 National Green Building Standard™ (NGBS) - the only residential green building rating system approved by ANSI as an American National Standard. The NGBS Green stringent third-party verified certification process ensures that homes and apartments are built in compliance with the NGBS and focuses on three highly marketable attributes: healthy homes; lower operating costs; and sustainable lifestyle. NGBS Green homes must achieve high performance metrics in several key areas, including, site design, resource efficiency, water efficiency, energy efficiency, indoor environmental quality, and building operation/maintenance. An NGBS Green Certified home can be awarded a Bronze, Silver, Gold, or Emerald certification level, depending on the number of green practices successfully incorporated in its design and construction. And NGBS Green is the only national green home certification program that requires increasingly higher point thresholds in every category – not merely an increase in the overall points for the home.

Pivotal's Axis platform is a cloud-based energy rating data and workflow management solution used by HERS Raters and Certification Organizations, home builders, and energy efficiency program sponsors to streamline collection and sharing of energy ratings and program certifications. The consolidation of Axis data and Home Innovation’s NGBS Green Certified home data furthers Pivotal’s commitment toward proper valuation of energy-efficient homes by establishing Axis as a trusted data hub that facilitates data sharing within the energy efficiency industry and with multiple listing services (MLS) and other real estate market data systems.

“We are excited to be working with Pivotal Energy Solutions,” said Michael Luzier, president and CEO of Home Innovation. “We believe this partnership is well-timed to remedy two of today’s most intractable market barriers when it comes to green homes – ensuring green certified homes receive the right valuation, and helping homebuyers and renters find them easily.”

To learn more about Axis, go to www.PivotalEnergySolutions.com or contact Bob Burns at 800-980-AXIS. For more information about Home Innovation Research Labs or the NGBS Green certification program, go to www.homeinnovation.com/green.

fields.title: Update - Tasks
fields.content: Axis allows users to record scheduled and completed tasks for a home. This can be used to schedule or track rating and verification-related tasks for a home such as field inspections or any other workflow tasks that have been completed by your company's users and contacts. These tasks are informational at this point but will be utilized by other functionality within Axis in the future. Read more...
